arts.ttl: Paul Warne issues Derby County verdict with two-word response to Cardiff City win
arts.sum: Paul Warne said he was "really proud" of his Derby County team as they made it three wins out of three at Pride Park in the Championship with a 1-0 victory over Cardiff. Former Bluebirds midfielder Ebou Adams, playing against Cardiff for the first time since his move to Derby in the summer, had a glorious opportunity to wrap the game up in stoppage but steered wide of an open goal.

arts.ttl: Leigh Curtis' Derby County player ratings v Cardiff as trio shine amid strange Cashin display - Leigh Curtis
arts.sum: Mendez-Laing came close to giving Derby a second however when he latched onto a wonderful 70-yard pass from Jerry Yates only to see his shot turned around the post by Alnwick. But Warne's side had their breakthrough with a lovely goal as from a throw, Jerry Yates' flick was collected by Callum Elder who raced down the left flank and steered a cross into the path of Kenzo Goudmijn who bagged his second goal in as many games.

arts.ttl: Kenzo Goudmijn goal earns Derby victory at home to struggling Cardiff
arts.sum: The Rams also had goalkeeper Jacob Widell Zetterstrom to thank for a string of fine saves.

Cardiff City : Alnwick, Ng (Fish 46'), Chambers, Goutas, Bagan (Willock 62'), Siopis, Ralls (Robertson 69'), R.Colwill, El Ghazi (Tanner 62'), O'Dowda, Kanga (Ashford 69'). He beat his man well but couldn't find the target with a right footed strike.

arts.ttl: Paul Warne names Derby County team to face Cardiff City as decision made on duo
arts.sum: Derby: Zetterstrom, Nyambe, Nelson, Cashin, Elder; Ozoh, Adams, Goudmijn; Mendez-Laing, Yates, Jackson Subs: Vickers, Forsyth, Bradley, Phillips, Collins, Osborn, Ward, Harness, Brown

arts.ttl: Derby County v Cardiff City LIVE updates and team news from Pride Park
arts.sum: The Rams produced a scintillating display to beat Bristol City 3-0 last time out to make it two wins out of two at home since the Championship season got under way. Derby County will be hoping to pick up where they left off before the international break as they face Cardiff City at Pride Park this afternoon.

arts.ttl: the forgotten Derby County XI and what happened next
arts.sum: The full-back arrived in January 2010 on loan from Manchester City until the end of the season, but the England U19 and U20 international made just one league appearance as a late substitute in a 3–0 win against Newcastle United at Pride Park Stadium before City boss Roberto Mancini activated a recall clause. He was signed as cover and was released in January 2017 when his contract was cancelled by mutual consent having not made a first-team appearance for the club.

arts.ttl: Chirewa out: Derby County team news and predicted XI to face Cardiff City
arts.sum: Derby County host Cardiff City at Pride Park this afternoon as focus returns to Championship action following the… The post Chirewa out: Derby County team news and predicted XI to face Cardiff City appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Ipswich tracksuits, oozing class and how Derby County's deadline day duo are settling in
arts.sum: They have also settled quickly into their new surroundings with Harness, who brought his huge Rottweiler, Kaiser, to the training ground on deadline day, being helped by former Portman Road team-mate Kayden Jackson. There is no dispute that Harness and Phillips, who arrived from Premier League duo Ipswich and Liverpool respectively, bring a wealth of expertise and quality to a team whose ambition this season is Championship consolidation.

After the break, whilst a lot of our lads were away experiencing international football, a lot of our players were still here and working hard, so we've reintegrated those international players back in this week and everyone is excited for Saturday's game. "I reflect on the first four games with positivity.
